name: Arizona Justice Alliance
description: Leading grassroots advocacy organization fighting for criminal justice reform across Arizona. We work directly with impacted communities to amplify voices and drive policy change through community organizing and legislative action.

name: Communities United for Dignity
description: A coalition of immigrant rights organizations dedicated to ending mass incarceration and protecting vulnerable communities from the private prison industry's harmful practices.

name: Faith Leaders for Justice
description: Interfaith coalition mobilizing religious communities across Arizona to advocate for humane alternatives to incarceration and restorative justice practices rooted in compassion and accountability.

name: Arizona Student Action Network
description: Youth-led movement organizing college students and young people to dismantle the school-to-prison pipeline and demand accountability from private prison corporations operating in Arizona.

name: Legal Defense Initiative
description: Public interest law firm providing free legal representation to individuals harmed by private prison negligence while pursuing systemic litigation to expose human rights violations and corporate malfeasance.

name: Formerly Incarcerated Voices
description: Peer-led organization centering the experiences and leadership of formerly incarcerated individuals in the movement to abolish private prisons and create pathways to healing and reintegration.

name: Healthcare for All Coalition
description: Advocates for adequate healthcare access in detention facilities and works to expose the medical neglect that is endemic in Arizona's private prison system, pushing for community-based health solutions.

name: Indigenous Justice Collective
description: Native-led organization addressing the disproportionate incarceration of Indigenous peoples and advocating for tribal sovereignty in criminal justice matters while opposing private prison expansion on tribal lands.
